DOC.detailed_description: Major depressive disorder ( MDD ) severe form depression . MDD significantly interfere individual 's thought , behavior , mood , physical health . People suffer MDD often experience feeling worthlessness ; may feel hopeless may unable cope problem life . In addition , often experience sleep disruption , loss appetite , chronic pain . It often take several week find antidepressant medication go work someone . This research study aim identify test able predict medication work , even person start feel well . The first test measurement blood protein Brain-Derived Neurotrophic Factor ( BDNF ) , involve brain cell growth . The second test Quantitative Electroencephalogram ( QEEG ) , measure brain activity . The study last 8 week involve 5 total visit clinic . Throughout study , subject receive either escitalopram ( Lexapro ) citalopram ( Celexa ) basis study doctor 's clinical judgment . The dose medication increase point time study doctor think appropriate . After first screen visit ( last 3 hour ) , subsequent half-hour visit involve 2-tablespoon blood draw measure BDNF level , well QEEG small , painless electrode stick subject 's forehead electrical activity brain measure . At end 8 week , subject offer 3 month free follow-up care , include medication .
